author: djrtwo
content: This is the tldr on the slashing from yesterday

author: djrtwo
content:
Custom remote signer with multiple independent nodes that make requests to this signer
 Pubkeys are assigned to nodes and can be duplicated

The signer had custom anti slashing logic that did not account for the surround attestation condition
One of the nodes was turned off for some time and when it turned back on was out of sync (stale latest justified)

So it triggered a surround of another vote from another node making different requests for the same keys

author: djrtwo
content:
.
Having multiple nodes think they are in charge of the same keys represents huge risk beyond a more basic setup 

For the above setup, I would instead recommend having a single VC living next to the keys or being 1:1 with the remote signer. This VC could then load balance across many BNs if desirable

Looks like vouch might be written as a VC that can handle this usecase

author: potuz
content: What happens to partial deposits? In principle it's possible to implement a withdrawal after the merge since they hold a valid bls key. Has this been discussed?

author: protolambda
content: Partial deposits are just like validators, except they are not activated until they reach 32 eth. Similarly small top-up deposits to existing validators are possible too. In the phase0 time of most validators neither is necessary though, and discouraged if you don't know what you are doing.

author: jgm
content: As it stands, a partial deposit couldn't be withdrawn as it isn't in the correct state.  I'd imagine it's not worth trying to fix that, and if someon puts in a 1 Ether deposit and wants it back they'd just have to put in another 31 Ether, work their way through the lifecycle, and withdraw at the end of it.
